title: Identify and Name
text: Let's first identify what we want to find, and then give it a variable name

title: Identify and Name
text: We know that we are trying to find the original price and we can name it "n"

title: Rewrite
text: Let's now rewrite the question into a simple sentence which sounds like an equation
speech: Let's now rewrite the question into a simple sentence which sounds like an equation

title: Rewrite
text: We would get "120 is two thirds of the original price"
speech: We would get "120 is two thirds of the original price"

title: Translate
text: Let's translate the rewritten sentence into a real equation
speech: Let's translate the rewritten sentence into a real equation

title: Translate
speech: We get , 120 is equal to 2 thirds n

title: Solve
text: What number can we divide from both sides to isolate the variable?
speech: What number can we divide from both sides to isolate the variable?
pacedSpeech: What number can we divide from both sides to isolate the variable?

title: Solve
text: When dividing a number by a fraction we are actually multiplying by the reciprocal. This makes the equation $$120\frac{3}{2}$$
speech: When dividing a number by a fraction we are actually multiplying by the reciprocal. This makes the equation , 120 and 3 halves
